ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We dove deeply into all topics surrounding climate change and the climate crisis.  This class was really focused on anthropology which was a new field of study for me.  I engaged with new forms of writing and thinking and expanded my perspectives on climate change.
i gained knowledge into an anthropological framework of the climate crisis

I learned much about the cultural aspects of the climate crisis, as the course was appropriately named. I learned about various theories, including those about different kinds of infrastructure, constructive approaches to reparation, and more.
A deeper understanding of the typologies of discourse around climate change. I learned the power and diversity of narrative necessary to speak to the masses.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings in this course were really interesting and I learned a lot through our discussions of them.  I wish there had been more opportunities for feedback throughout the semester.
strength is in the professor and the small class size! lots of intimate conversations to truly allow us to shape the class in the direction we want

There wasn't too much structure to this course, which made it nice because we could freely flow in each week's seminar. However, it would've been nice to have a bit more structure to discussion and the requirements for the different parts of the final project. The once a week format was nice, but given the theory-heavy nature of the readings, it was sometimes difficult to maintain discussion for a large portion of the hour and 50 minutes we were in class. I think I would have appreciated if there were more guidance to apply the theories we read about.
I think more project-based learning could be exciting in this class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student.  The readings and topics were interesting and made me think about the climate crisis in an entirely new way.
yes! the professor is fantastic and very sweet

I would only recommend this course to another student if they were interested in learning about theory (which is ultimately important in expanding one's view of the climate crisis). This course was a theory heavy course.
Yes. It is very theoretical but sets deep thinkers up to come up with their own solutions.
